content:
Qiang Fu is a Research Scientist at King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST) in the Computational Imaging Group, working with Prof. Wolfgang Heidrich.
Qiang Fu’s research interests lie in the multidisciplinary research areas of computational imaging and display that develops emerging and fast-growing visual computing technologies by integrating state-of-the-art techniques in computer vision, computer graphics, optics, deep learning, inverse problem, and nano-fabrication. Such developing technologies could harness applications in various areas, including photography, machine vision, virtual/mixed reality, underwater imaging, medical imaging, microscopy, endoscopy, spectral imaging, and so on.
Feel free to contact me by email: qiang.fu@kaust.edu.saor fuqiangx@outlook.com
summary:
Qiang Fu is a Research Scientist at King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST) in the Computational Imaging Group, working with Prof. Wolfgang Heidrich.
Qiang Fu’s research interests lie in the multidisciplinary research areas of computational imaging and display that develops emerging and fast-growing visual computing technologies by integrating state-of-the-art techniques in computer vision, computer graphics, optics, deep learning, inverse problem, and nano-fabrication. Such developing technologies could harness applications in various areas, including photography, machine vision, virtual/mixed reality, underwater imaging, medical imaging, microscopy, endoscopy, spectral imaging, and so on.

summary: We propose a hybrid lens design by positioning a DOE off-aperture to optimize image quality for large field-of-view.
title: Learned Off-aperture Encoding for Wide Field-of-view RGBD Imaging

summary: We introduce a new paradigm that combines optics and software to encode image information directly into the semantically rich latent space of a generative model.
title: Latent Space Imaging

summary: We presents a hardware-software co-designed RGBD imaging framework to reconstruct texture-rich color images along with detailed depth maps over a wide depth range.
title: Learned Binocular-Encoding Optics for RGBD Imaging Using Joint Stereo and Focus Cues

summary: We introduced a fully automated lens design algorithm that uses deep optics and differentiable ray tracing.
title: An AI Curriculum for Learning Lens Design

summary: We introduced a fully automated lens design algorithm that uses deep optics and differentiable ray tracing.
title: Ultra-Wide-Angle High-Fidelity Holographic Displays

summary: We propose a new hybrid ray-tracing and wave-propagation (ray-wave) model for accurate simulation of both optical aberrations and diffractive phase modulation.
title: End-to-end hybrid refractive-diffractive lens design with differentiable ray-wave model

summary: We propose and demonstrate a linearized model for phase diversity wavefront sensing, facilitating real-time processing and much less data required for training.
title: Linearized wavefront sensing model for aberration retrieval from low-frequency Fourier coefficients

summary: We propose a self-supervised method tailored for coded aperture snapshot spectral imaging (CASSI).
title: Progressive self-supervised learning for CASSI computational spectral cameras

summary: We propose a comparative analysis of DOEs fabricated by multi-level photolithography and grayscale lithography.
title: Comparative performance analysis of multi-level diffractive lens and lens fabricated by grayscale lithography and soft-imprinting

summary: We show that significant limitations exist arising from the lack of diversity in the prevailing hyperspectral image datasets.
title: Limitations of hyperspectral imaging from RGB images: A data perspective

summary: We employ B-spline parameterization for the DOE surface geometry representation for RGBD imaging.
title: Learned B-spline parametrization of lattice focal coding for monocular RGBD imaging

summary: The CAL2 project is being built for the GPI calibration system.
title: CAL2: project update of the NRC Canada facility-class focal plane wavefront sensor for the Gemini Planet Imager 2 upgrade

summary: We present DeepLens, a method to learn optical designs of compound lenses ab initio from randomly initialized surfaces without human intervention.
title: Curriculum learning for ab initio deep learned refractive optics

summary: We propose a method to split conventional camera apertures into two halves along with a dual-pixel sensor for various computational imaging applications.
title: Split-aperture 2-in-1 computational cameras

content:
Citation
@article{tseng2024neural, title={Neural {\'e}tendue expander for ultra-wide-angle high-fidelity holographic display}, author={Tseng, Ethan and Kuo, Grace and Baek, Seung-Hwan and Matsuda, Nathan and Maimone, Andrew and Schiffers, Florian and Chakravarthula, Praneeth and Fu, Qiang and Heidrich, Wolfgang and Lanman, Douglas and others}, journal={Nature Communications}, volume={15}, number={1}, pages={2907}, year={2024}, publisher={Nature Publishing Group UK London} } All images are © Springer Nature, reproduced here by permission of Springer Nature for your personal use. Not for redistribution.
summary: We present a method to expand the étendue of holographic displays by 64x with a learned diffractive optical element.
title: Neural Étendue expander for ultra-wide-angle high-fidelity holographic display

summary: We propose an alternative method for fabricating DOEs without RIE lag and with improved surface smoothness.
title: Additive fabrication of SiO2-based micro-optics with lag-free depth and reduced roughness

summary: We explore the use of hexagonal grids as a new grid structure for DOE design and fabrication.
title: Hexagonal diffractive optical elements

summary: We propose a new way to fabricate multi-level DOEs by directly growing an optically transparent material on a glass substrate.
title: Additive diffractive optical elements fabrication by PECVP deposition of SiO2 and lift-off process

summary: We explore bridging the gap between aberrations and depth-from-focus through aberration-aware training (AAT).
title: Aberration-aware depth-from-focus

summary: We propose a generalized Fourier-based PDWS method by combining an object-independent network with a system-independent image processing procedure.
tags: Phase diversity, wavefront sensing, neural network
title: Generalization of learned Fourier-based phase-diversity wavefront sensing

summary: We propose an end-to-end joint optimization method to learn a DOE placed in front of a projector lens and a compensation network for deblurring.
title: Extended Depth-of-Field Projector using Learned Diffractive Optics

summary: We propose a lensless camera with an optimized Voronoi-Fresnel phase by maximizing the Modulation Transfer Function volume.
title: Diffractive lensless imaging with optimized Voronoi-Fresnel phase

summary: We propose an effective neural network based on low-frequency coefficients in the Fourier domain to determine a better estimate of the unknown aberrations.
tags: Phase diversity, wavefront sensing, neural network
title: Phase-diversity wavefront sensing enhanced by a Fourier-based neural network

@inproceedings{marois2022deployment, title={Deployment of focal plane WFS technologies on 8-m telescopes: from the {Subaru SPIDERS} pathfinder, to the facility-class {GPI 2.0} system}, author={Marois, Christian and Lardi{\`e}re, Olivier and Thompson, William and Singh, Garima and Johnson, Adam and Hardy, Tim and Fitzsimmons, Joeleff and Gerard, Benjamin L and Sivanandam, Suresh and Thibault, Simon and others}, booktitle={Adaptive Optics Systems VIII}, volume={12185}, pages={594--603}, year={2022}, organization={SPIE} } All images are © SPIE, reproduced here by permission of SPIE for your personal use. summary: The NRC Canada is funding two projects, the SPIDERS pathfinder at the Subaru telescope (ETA 2023), and the CAL2 upgrade of the Gemini Planet Imager-2 (ETA 2024), to deploy a modified self-coherent camera (based on FAST) to measure the focal plane electric field, and to apply wavefront corrections in a closed-loop down to 10s of ms in a narrow band.
title: Deployment of focal plane WFS technologies on 8-m telescopes: from the Subaru SPIDERS pathfinder, to the facility-class GPI 2.0 CAL2 system

summary: We propose a monocular single-shot imaging approach that optically cloaks obstructions by emulating a large array.
title: Seeing through obstructions with diffractive cloaking

title: Automatic lens design based on differentiable ray-tracing

summary: We present a thorough investigation of more than 25 state-of-the-art spectral reconstruction methods.
title: A survey on computational spectral reconstruction methods from RGB to hyperspectral imaging

summary: This review reports the latest methods, algorithms, and applications in computational imaging.
title: Recent progress in computational imaging

summary: We introduce a new dataset synthesis method as well as a novel neural network architecture for single image reflection removal.

summary: We propose an additive lithographic fabrication process to realize simultaneous micrometer and millimeter features.

summary: We propose a general end-to-end complex lens design framework enabled by a differentiable ray tracing image formation model.
